Container.Name: OmbiBot
Container.Overview: A Slack bot for Ombi request management
Container.WebUI: http://[IP]:[PORT:3000]/ (or use the PORT environment variable if changed)
Container.Description:
OmbiBot is a Slack bot that integrates with Ombi for media request management. Users can search and request movies via Slack commands. The bot connects to your Ombi instance and Plex media server to enable easy media discovery and requests directly from Slack.
PORT CONFIGURATION: The default port is 3000. To use a different port: 1. Edit the PORT environment variable (default: 3000) 2. Edit the Container Port mapping below to match the PORT value 3. Set the Host Port to the port you want to expose on your Unraid server

Variable.Name: SLACK_API_TOKEN
Variable.Description: REQUIRED: Your Slack Bot API Token (starts with xoxb-). Get it from https://api.slack.com/apps

Variable.Name: OMBI_URL
Variable.Description: REQUIRED: URL to your Ombi instance (e.g., http://ombi:5000 or http://192.168.1.100:5000)

Variable.Name: OMBI_API_KEY
Variable.Description: REQUIRED: Your Ombi API Key (get from Ombi settings)

Variable.Name: PORT
Variable.Description: Port for the bot to listen on (default 3000, must match container port below)

Variable.Name: OMBI_USER
Variable.Description: Optional: Ombi username (if needed for API calls)

Variable.Name: PLEX_URL
Variable.Description: Optional: URL to your Plex Media Server
